hints.section: ## Exponential Convergence for Non-Convex Fitness Landscapes: Hypocoercivity and Feynman-Kac Theory
hints.raw_directive:
5104: This document establishes exponential KL-convergence using a **strictly weaker assumption** that we **already have**:
5105: 
5106: :::{prf:axiom} Confining Potential (from 04_convergence.md, Axiom 1.3.1)
5107: :label: axiom-confining-recap
5108: 
5109: The potential $U: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ satisfies:
5110: 
5111: $$
5112: U(x) \to +\infty \quad \text{as} \quad |x| \to \infty \quad \text{or} \quad x \to \partial \mathcal{X}
5113: $$
5114: 
5115: Equivalently, there exist constants $\alpha_U > 0$ and $R_0 > 0$ such that:
5116: 
5117: $$
5118: \langle \nabla U(x), x \rangle \geq \alpha_U |x|^2 \quad \text{for all} \quad |x| \geq R_0

hints.label: thm-nonconvex-informal
hints.title: Exponential KL Convergence for Non-Convex Fitness (Informal)
hints.content:
5133: :label: thm-nonconvex-informal
5134: 
5135: For the N-particle Euclidean Gas with a **confining potential** (Axiom {prf:ref}`axiom-confining-recap`) but **no convexity assumption**:
5136: 
5137: $$
5138: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\lambda t} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
5139: $$
5140: 
5141: where:
5142: 
5143: $$
5144: \lambda = c \cdot \min\left(\gamma, \frac{\alpha_U}{\sigma_v^2}\right) - C \cdot L_g \cdot G_{\max}
5145: $$
